page.title: 15The Fire Station
page.content: Chew Magna fire station was opened in 1953 by the Chief Fire Inspector for Somerset. Currently there are eight firemen, all of whom have other jobs such as a builder,a chef,a gardener,an electrician,a carpenter,an accountant and an undertaker.As part-time firemen they are 'retained' and the training for them lasts for three weeks with ongoing training every Monday night. Every fireman carries an alerter 24 hours a day. There is only one fire engine in Chew Magna.Before the fire appliance can leave there must be four firemen on board. Fortunately few false alarms occur and the most common fires near Chew Magna are chimney fires and hedge fires.The biggest cause of fire is children playing with matches.
